document_data.name: Footfall
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|20}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Footfall''''' was a haunting [[cantrip]] that acolyte [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It could create the illusory sound of [[humanoid]] footsteps nearby.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip produced the auditory illusion of footsteps within a radius of {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} from the caster.The description of this cantrip in [[Dragon magazine 60|''Dragon'' #60]] used the notation 2" which can be interpreted as {{SI|20|yd|long=yes}}, but the ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]'' chose this to be {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} instead. The sound appeared to originate within {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} of the caster and then moved wherever the caster desired as determined by the [[somatic]] gesture. The footsteps could be made to approach, recede, follow, stop, start, and so on. The volume of the illusory tread could vary from soft to somewhat noisy.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and somatic components to cast. The caster subvocalized the sound of footsteps while pointing at the location from which the sound appeared to emanate.
